Harry Stamper.Action: Playfully hits a golf ball at a Greenpeace boat, narrowly missing a protester; calls protesters 'little bastard' and 'stupid birds'.
Warns his daughter Grace to watch her language.
Shows protective attitude about a crew member Chick getting hurt, calling it 'good' he is not vulnerable there.
Encourages his daughter to 'keep twisting' on financing deals like a pit bull, supportive of her efforts.
Jokes about disliking flying and oil company executives, deflects dealing with them to his daughter, says he looks better when she's doing the talking.
Hits a golf ball skillfully, striking close to a Greenpeace boat, showing confident physical ability and focus.

Keeps a calm, strategic attitude when discussing risky operational conditions ('The drill string kicked twice this morning...Good. He's not vulnerable there.'), showing knowledge and confidence in safety assessments.
Responds confidently and decisively to financial setbacks ('Thieves and cowards, all of 'em. Twist their arms.'), portraying a tough, proactive business mindset.
Uses humor and deflects uncomfortable topics ('I always look better when you're doing the talking.') to maintain control of social/business interactions.
Expresses casual friendliness and humor toward Greenpeace protesters despite conflicting interests.
Dismisses environmental concerns sarcastically and insists on continuing drilling regardless.
Commands his crew to start drilling immediately despite protest, showing impatience.
Urgently orders crew to rig up another pipe quickly to manage a dangerous situation, showing responsibility and concern.
Calmly interacts with Greenpeace protesters using humor and confidence to manage a tense situation.
Refuses to be intimidated by protesters, insists on continuing drilling and takes command decisively.
Commands his team effectively to start drilling immediately despite conflict.
Instructs rapid and precise rigging of another pipe to address a well pressure issue, demonstrating technical skill and leadership under pressure.
Dismisses Greenpeace's environmental concerns with sarcasm rather than engagement, potentially overlooking an opportunity for compromise or deeper understanding.
Dismisses A.J.'s concerns with sarcasm but ultimately puts trust in him and lets him take control of drilling despite his inexperience.
Strips off his jacket and personally climbs into the dangerous, brine-filled drilling hole to assist A.J. in a life-threatening situation.
Physically helps free A.J. when he is pinned in the drilling hole, demonstrating personal courage and care for his colleague.
Commands the team to rig up another pipe immediately and proceed at full speed despite risks, showing confidence and assertiveness.
Dismisses A.J.'s concerns based on his own 30 years of experience, taking control of the drilling operation.
Responds quickly and physically by stripping off his jacket and diving into the wellhead to assist in a dangerous situation.
Successfully frees A.J. trapped inside the flooded drilling hole, demonstrating resourcefulness and physical capability.
Ignores warnings and proceeds with a high-risk approach that results in the pipe snapping and flooding, indicating possible overconfidence or recklessness.
Scrambles out covered in crude oil and immediately grabs Grace to pull her away from danger.
After chaos, firmly tells the Oil Executives to get off his rig, showing protective care for his crew and territory.
Quietly contrasts with A.J.'s pointed remark, does not engage in conflict or boasting.
Firmly tells Major Stinson to say it quickly or get off his rig, prioritizing business but being direct and straightforward.
Acknowledges Dan Golden politely and shows familiarity, indicating a straightforward and respectful attitude.
Introduces and shows respect for his team by calling them his right and left arms and having them handle conversations.
Responds to Quincy's handshake with a somewhat reserved comment and avoids reciprocating the eagerness fully.
Leans over and kisses the drill bit in a display of pride and affection for his work, showing enthusiasm.
Appears distant or slightly confused about being treated like a celebrity, suggesting some social reserve or guardedness.
Immediately recognizes the uniqueness and difficulty of the drilling task ('I've drilled in them all.'), shows confidence and expertise in drilling.
Expresses skepticism about drilling in space but seeks to understand the rig and mission details, showing intelligent caution and willingness to engage.
Questions the feasibility of drilling an 800-foot hole on a moving asteroid, displaying critical thinking and realistic assessment.
Confronts Quincy about patent theft and expresses frustration over stolen design.
Acknowledges the hard work and instinct required in drilling, emphasizing practical experience.
Recognizes his own patented design and immediately identifies the technology; confidently criticizes the misuse and the design flaws.
Demonstrates practical knowledge and instinct about drilling, relying on hands-on experience rather than formal education.
Challenges the so-called experts with Ph.D.s by pointing out their lack of practical understanding.
Expresses frustration with the government and the project's management but maintains clear focus on the technical failings.
Rescues Tito Guevara from the streets and puts him to work on a rig, helping to turn his life around.
Has successfully rescued Tito from the streets and put him to work on a rig, demonstrating leadership and practical problem-solving.
Refers to a geophysicist as a 'meek, geek,' suggesting a possible underestimation or dismissive attitude towards technical expertise.
Responds confidently to the doctor's concerns, defends his men effectively, and maintains focus on their job performance despite negative test results.
Shows some detachment from his men's personal issues (drug and alcohol use), which might indicate overlooking potential risks.
Leads a crew of roughneck drillers adapting to NASA jumpsuits and new space mission roles, indicating flexibility and leadership under unusual conditions.
Effectively communicates with team and technical staff regarding equipment (Armadillo drill car), demonstrating hands-on knowledge and initiative.
Is part of a crew described by military and NASA officials as 'not trained' for space drilling, highlighting a lack of formal training and institutional preparation.
Asks practical questions about powering the drill arm, insists on having control over start, stop, speed, and reverse.
Refers to himself as a 'simple man' and appreciates others' recognition of his idea as brilliant, showing humility and sincerity.
Designs a drill arm powered by a turbo-jet engine with a clutch and uses a Mack truck transmission to enable starting, stopping, variable speeds, and reverse.
Explains his technical solution confidently despite Quincy's doubts.
Gives Bear a 'shut the fuck up' look after Bear's embarrassing gastric sound.
Shows discipline and focus during astronaut training despite difficult physical challenges underwater.
Gives a silent 'shut the fuck up' look to Bear, demonstrating control over group morale and situation.
Expresses regret for past wrongs and acknowledges Denise's new life, showing respect for her situation.
Sincerely compliments Denise, calling her beautiful.
Keeps a respectful distance regarding his involvement, not interfering unnecessarily with Denise's life.
Quickly assesses the situation and follows the team heading to Mission Control without hesitation.
Maintains eye contact with A.J., signaling awareness and control in the tense situation.
Takes initiative to be present in Mission Control during critical moments, indicating leadership and readiness.
Clearly explains the critical mission details and the importance of timing to the team, demonstrating trustworthiness and responsibility.
Responds tersely to a question about feasibility, showing some impatience and unwillingness to tolerate doubt.
Encourages others to focus on their roles while he takes responsibility for drilling, indicating leadership and confidence that can inspire trust.
Identifies the deepest fault line as the optimal drilling spot and clearly explains the mission constraints and timing to the team.
Responds confidently and assertively to skepticism about drilling an eight-hundred foot hole in eight hours, maintaining control of the situation.
Refuses to override safety limits and warns against exceeding RPM limits despite pressure.
Shows disappointment and suppresses anger when A.J. disobeys orders and damages equipment.
Stands firm to keep A.J. on the team because he trusts him, despite others wanting to remove him.
Rejects Golden's dismissive attitude towards independent thinkers and insists on choosing his own team for confidence and trust.
Confronts A.J. directly about his attitude but expresses his expectations clearly and firmly.
Stands up for A.J. despite being tough on him.
Shares personal story of hardship and perseverance, revealing vulnerability and sincerity.
Dismisses A.J.'s attempts to lead the team as 'cowboy shit' without providing encouragement.
Confronts A.J. decisively, insists on chain of command, and demands respect for his leadership.
Shares personal story of persistence and success in drilling, demonstrating deep industry knowledge and confidence.
Insists on discipline and following orders to maintain team effectiveness.
Cuts the medal into two perfect halves and shares one with A.J., demonstrating thoughtful symbolism and leadership.
Leads final mission drills and ensures all systems function without error, showing thorough preparation and skill.
Takes time to reflect and give credit to others, indicating emotional intelligence and confidence in his role.
Expresses pride and love openly to his daughter Gracie, saying no father has ever been prouder and telling her he loves her.
Hugs Gracie, showing physical affection tenderly.
Expresses rare, sincere emotional support to his daughter, showing emotional intelligence that complements his leadership.
Leads his crew confidently and with a serious demeanor toward a critical mission, demonstrating clear leadership and preparedness.
Rejects the NASA technicians' effort to make the shuttle feel more like home by discarding their metal components, stating 'We don't need music and we don't mind dirty utensils.'
Enters the MIR station confidently with his team, actively engages in initial assessment of the environment.
Allows Lev to film and interact without interference, demonstrating social ease and confidence in unfamiliar environment.
Does not immediately question Lev's odd behavior or lack of professionalism (such as filming antics), which could indicate a missed opportunity for stricter control over mission protocol.
Unhooks the shuttles quickly, then runs decisively through dangerous corridors amid explosions and fires.
Successfully races toward docking module amidst chaos and structural failure.
Rushes to hold open the closing shuttle doors to allow A.J. to board, despite imminent danger.
Rushes into Shuttle Freedom and grabs the closing door just in time, ensuring people can board and escape.
Frantically searches for A.J. during the shuttle boarding under extreme pressure, showing situational awareness and concern.
Reflects on his life with a moment of self-awareness and regret about environmental harm from oil extraction while looking at Earth.
Remains focused and composed while approaching the Moon and asteroid despite loss of visual contact with the target.
Stares in awe at the lunar surface with others, showing momentary distraction.
Follows training to flex arms and breathe deeply under extreme G-forces during shuttle acceleration.
Expresses personal fear by saying 'I hate to fly' repeatedly under stress.
Remains present and alert during a dangerous debris storm despite physical discomfort (green and nauseous).
No direct action or statement by Harry Stamper in this excerpt; the situation is chaotic and handled by others (Truman, Sharp).
Successfully pilots Shuttle Freedom to avoid a massive boulder by skidding to a stop inches away, demonstrating control under extreme conditions.
Remains calm and motionless immediately after landing, showing controlled composure under intense pressure.
Remains composed and immediately shifts focus from grief over lost men to the work that needs to be done, showing emotional control and prioritization under pressure.
Snaps out of shock and calmly instructs Chick to deal with the loss and move forward, demonstrating leadership and decisiveness.
Approaches cockpit to assist and maintain engagement with team technical issues despite emotional strain.
Speaks encouragingly to Rockhound, showing trust in his expertise ('Rocks are my life').
Uses blunt, somewhat sarcastic humor when reporting bad news ('The good news just keeps comin').
Observes surroundings quietly and calmly, showing reflection and steadiness.
Focuses on task, gives clear directions without overt emotional expression.
Directs Rockhound to get surface samples to understand their challenge, showing proactive leadership and planning.
Stalks to the rear, signifying confident control and focus.
Uses instruments (seismic instrument, soil sampler) to test the terrain methodically, indicating technical skill and thoroughness.
Detects that the ground is bedrock from repeated, careful testing, showing strong observational ability and knowledge.
Not satisfied with initial tests, searches further to find a better drilling spot and marks it precisely, illustrating persistence and sound judgment.
Responds to bad news with a sarcastic comment 'The good news just keeps comin'.', which could indicate stress but does not detract from his action capability.
Tries to encourage Bear after the drill bit is destroyed, telling him to 'Get that off your face' and reassuring him they've seen worse before.
Shuts down Max's despairing comment with a curt 'Shut up, Max.'
Analyzes rock chips and understands the significance of drilling into forged iron slab, showing technical insight.
Admits that the drill bit was eaten quickly and that they are drilling into a difficult spot, indicating honesty and realistic appraisal of the situation.
Responds to mission control's challenge to go faster with confidence and willingness, showing determination and leadership.
Immediately assesses the problem when the drill pipe stops and decides to increase RPM to get it descending again, showing quick technical understanding.
Confidently orders full throttle despite warnings about potential damage, prioritizing mission success under pressure.
Calmly reacts to equipment failure by deciding to switch to the second rig without panic.
Directly addresses the crew with urgency and clarity, pushing to continue drilling despite difficult circumstances.
Walks off angry when frustrated by the situation, showing emotional honesty but also frustration.
Calls out his scientists bluntly about the information regarding the nuclear device, showing bluntness but also trust in his own team.
Firmly insists on drilling rather than surface detonation, demonstrating commitment and resolve to the crew’s mission and safety.
Encourages and motivates his team by assigning new assistants and expressing confidence in their abilities to fix the shuttle despite difficulties.
Shows frustration and disappointment after learning about extreme temperature risks late but remains focused.
Directly appeals to Colonel Sharp for help, expressing the need for teamwork and manpower.
Demonstrates firm determination and confidence by insisting on completing the drilling mission despite high stakes, showing leadership under pressure.
Not present in the excerpt; no actions or statements by Harry Stamper to evaluate competence.
No direct action present in the excerpt; focused on A.J. and Lev's incident with the Armadillo vehicle. Harry's competence cannot be judged here.
Tells crew to toughen up and keep working despite difficult conditions.
Orders his crew to drill a significant amount in record time and quickly adapts when the transmission linkage blows by deciding to use parts from the other rig.
Responds firmly to crew complaints about the heat by telling them to toughen up and continue working.
Urgently commands Chick and Max to unbolt the tranny to prevent disaster, shows concern for the crew's safety.
Urges Chick to stay and work together to fix the problem despite the devastating failure.
Ignores Sharp's suggestion to retreat and detonate, insisting on continuing the effort.
Clenches medallion and silently wills victory, showing personal determination but no outward expression of comfort to others.
Fails to console or acknowledge the fear and trauma of losing Max and the rig, simply pressing to continue.
Refuses to accept defeat after a catastrophic failure of the drilling rig, insists on trying to fix the problem by welding parts together and going at one speed.
Ignores advice to abandon the mission and detonate the nuclear device, showing commitment and confidence in problem-solving.
Physical reaction of clenching medallion and shutting eyes tightly, indicating emotional struggle but no paralysis—persists despite overwhelming odds.
Fails to inspire Chick to follow; Chick believes it is over and walks off, indicating a potential gap in leadership or urgency in communication.
For the first time on the asteroid, smiles genuinely upon seeing A.J.'s Armadillo arrive, expresses hope and relief.
Greets Chick and Bear warmly with enthusiasm and inclusive language ('Boys, we're back in business!').
Shares good news over radio calmly and matter-of-factly; acknowledges absence of other survivors respectfully.
Leads the drilling operation, closely monitors team, and listens to A.J.'s suggestion despite initial hesitation.
Steps up and takes charge of a dangerous problem, insists someone must go down the hole despite obvious risk.
Encourages A.J. by giving a 'do or die' command, expressing trust in him.
Listens to A.J.'s sincere personal declaration about marrying his daughter, reacts with a soft, 'priceless' look.
Shows concern for Sharp after he gets injured, hopes for his well-being.
Encourages A.J. to give everything he has during a critical moment.
Stays composed and focused amid chaotic drilling and equipment failure.
Dives for ripped safety tether to save A.J. before he is thrown into space.
Lashes A.J.'s tether to the Armadillo to secure safety during dangerous events.
Dives down inside an indentation to protect himself from a massive boulder, enduring danger alongside others.
Does not flee or abandon others during the dangerous situation on the asteroid.
After being caught by a massive rolling boulder, Harry falls but quickly recovers and takes cover in a small indentation, avoiding injury as the boulder passes over him.
Does not attempt to outrun or confront the rolling boulder directly but instinctively seeks immediate protection by diving into an indentation, demonstrating quick thinking under pressure.
Tells Chick to put down the diamond, showing respect for Pitt's corpse and the gravity of the situation.
Calmly explains the manual detonation means one of them won't leave, preparing the team for sacrifice.

Upon learning the remote detonator is shot, calmly explains the consequence without panic: 'Means one of us ain't leaving.' Demonstrates clear understanding of the gravity of the situation and communicates it straightforwardly.
Commands Chick to put down the diamond and keep focus on the mission, preventing distraction with valuable yet irrelevant findings.
Leads the team to quickly reorganize and carry the damaged nuclear device to the drill hole, showing practical skill and leadership under pressure.
Commands Chick to sit down during a tense moment, demonstrating leadership and control.
Confidently insists A.J. draw in the high-stakes straw draw, showing confidence and bravery.
Shares a sincere and heartfelt comment to A.J. about wanting a son and wishing he was like him.
Carries the heavy wire spool-drum himself while descending onto the asteroid.
Cuts off A.J.'s air tubes and ejects him into the airlock to stay at the drilling site despite personal cost.
Shows emotional strength and resolve by insisting on staying with the drill hole despite intense pressure and personal sacrifice.
Remains calm and determined in a critical moment, demonstrating leadership and confidence.
Expresses deep love and pride for Grace in a vulnerable video message.
Refers to himself as an 'iron-ass-warrior' doing what’s best, showing a tough exterior but underlying care.
Gives clear ultimatums and shows impatience with the shuttle thruster malfunction, emphasizing urgency over pleasantries.
Communicates clearly and decisively, insisting on the three-minute timeline and readiness to push the detonator himself.
Maintains emotional composure despite personal hardship, focusing on mission-critical tasks.
Monitors the thruster failure with irritation and gives direct orders to resolve the issue quickly.
Urgently commands Sharp to get the shuttle moving and to evacuate, showing concern for Sharp's safety.
Closes his eyes and prepares to detonate under pressure, exhibiting resolve but limited emotional openness.
Gives a direct order to get out of danger, showing decisive command under pressure.
Closes his eyes and prepares for detonation, demonstrating calm acceptance of a critical decision.
Does not interfere with technical troubleshooting, trusting specialists to handle problems.
Presses the detonator with a tear in his eye, showing emotional vulnerability in a life-threatening moment.
Crawls out of the hole and runs across dangerous terrain on the asteroid to manually detonate the nuclear device, successfully splitting the asteroid as planned.
Hesitates briefly with a tear welling in his eye before pressing the detonator, showing emotional conflict but still completing the critical task.
Acknowledges A.J.'s nervousness and listens to him patiently as he struggles to express himself.
Responds firmly but fairly to Oil Executives' complaints, using candid language to express frustration.
Greets Greenpeace protesters politely, seeking to understand their position despite the interruption.
Introduces his trusted deputies, clearly delegating authority and defining communication channels.
Responds with calm confidence to an unusual request, showing openness to problem-solving.
Known for numerous past technical achievements and innovations in deep drilling despite skepticism from others.
Insists on including his crew in the mission, stating he is only as good as the men he works with.
Offers to sell his patent for a high price, then cheekily says to give the money to Greenpeace and jokes about not paying taxes again.
Withdraws hand repeatedly when reaching for handshakes, avoiding formalities.
Refuses to be excluded from the mission despite others' objections, showing protectiveness over his team.
States he'd rather die fighting the threat in space than waiting to die on Earth, inspiring others to join him.
Stands with Grace and A.J. during crisis, showing presence with close ones.
Harry's all business, focused on devastation statistics, doesn't express emotional comfort.
Acknowledges the fear openly and encourages honesty about the danger, looking team members in the eye and giving them the option to leave if they are not up to the task.
Refers to NASA technicians as 'clean-cut pussies' to motivate his team, potentially disrespectful but intended to build confidence.
Collaborates closely with team members on technical solutions, praises contributions like A.J.'s.
Insists on increasing power despite warnings about machinery damage.
Immediately decides to move on to the second rig after equipment failure without assigning blame or showing frustration.
Insists on drilling the hole despite challenges and threats of surface detonation; confidently confronts uncertainty about the nuclear weapon and pushes for a skillful solution.
Walks off pissed off when hearing about the difficulty drilling the hole, showing frustration but no immediate alternative plan given in the excerpt.
Notices the drill kicking and immediately orders Chick to unbolt the tranny despite initial resistance.
Shows quick situational awareness and directs team members clearly during the dangerous trembler event.
Climbs to the drill platform despite violent shaking to continue commanding the operation.
Oversees a complex drilling operation with precise coordination and effective teamwork on the asteroid surface.
Recognizes dangerous pressure levels and immediately orders the drill to stop despite pressure to continue.
Debates but ultimately accepts A.J.'s risky suggestion to drill full throttle through dangerous pressure, showing confidence in his team's judgment.
Encourages drawing straws fairly and insists Chick sit down despite tension.
Lets A.J. take his turn first and faces the risk himself.
Stays behind on the asteroid to manually detonate the bomb, risking and ultimately sacrificing his life to save others.
